channel.title: Comments for The Works of Matt Lockyer

item.title: Comment on Minecraft Steve Easy Costume Template (wine box design) by Susan Tatun
item.dc:creator: Susan Tatun
item.description: Love your new head. It was special and awesome. Perhaps, I will make one for my little son because he felt excited when seeing it. Thanks for sharing here.
item.content:encoded: Love your new head. It was special and awesome. Perhaps, I will make one for my little son because he felt excited when seeing it. Thanks for sharing here.

item.title: Comment on Close a Twitter Bootstrap Popover when Clicking Outside by sulaimaan
item.dc:creator: sulaimaan

item.title: Comment on Close a Twitter Bootstrap Popover when Clicking Outside by Yuri
item.dc:creator: Yuri

item.title: Comment on Close a Twitter Bootstrap Popover when Clicking Outside by Subodh
item.dc:creator: Subodh

item.title: Comment on Close a Twitter Bootstrap Popover when Clicking Outside by Tim
item.dc:creator: Tim
item.description:
This was very helpful, thanks very much.
If using fake selectors isn't your thing, you could use the popover plugin's data-container attribute to have the popovers appended to some container, such as #popoverContainer, and then use $(':not(#popoverContainer)') on line #1. (I haven't tried that on iOS.)
item.content:encoded:
This was very helpful, thanks very much.

If using fake selectors isn’t your thing, you could use the popover plugin’s data-container attribute to have the popovers appended to some container, such as #popoverContainer, and then use $(‘:not(#popoverContainer)’) on line #1. (I haven’t tried that on iOS.)

item.title: Comment on Where by Toby Reid
item.dc:creator: Toby Reid
item.description: Hi Matt, Love your stuff, please get in touch if you're ever in Sydney. I'm currently doing web development but getting more into interactive visualisations during the weekend as a hobby, hopefully 'performing' soon. Regards, Toby
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,
Love your stuff, please get in touch if you’re ever in Sydney. I’m currently doing web development but getting more into interactive visualisations during the weekend as a hobby, hopefully ‘performing’ soon.
Regards,
Toby
